document_data.name: Long Road
document_data.mainbody: The '''Long Road''' was an astonishing thousands-of-miles-long tunnel running through the [[Underdark]] below the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]] and much of [[Faerûn]], in use by [[dwarves]] of the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Geography:
Its course took it through the Underdark domains of the [[Deep Wastes]], the [[Glimmersea]], [[Darklands]], and [[Great Bhaerynden]].<ref>

It appeared to start at the dwarven village of [[Glen]] in the [[Dalelands]], where an elevator accessed the "Deep Mine", a disguised tunnel to the Underdark. From there the Long Road ran south beneath the Inner Sea. On the way, it linked to several other dwarven communities, such as [[Dwarves' Deep (settlement)|Dwarves' Deep]], and went as far as the great dwarven realm of the [[Great Rift]] in [[south Faerûn]].
document_data.Activities:
The Long Road was traveled by dedicated dwarven [[Underdark merchant]]s. In the 1360s DR, the Glen dwarves traded their produce and goods to fellow dwarves along the Long Road, and guarded and patrolled their section well. In return, they received [[mushroom]]s and even live [[dragon]] eggs, which they sold onto visiting dwarves on the surface. The [[human]]s of nearby [[Mistledale]] had only just suspected an Underdark connection by [[1372 DR]].

Elsewhere, however, the Long Road was plagued by frequent attacks from [[drow]] and other subterranean creatures.
